posts.post_content:
It's like [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), except cheaper, gives it -1/0, and doesn't give you the choice of playing it at instant speed.   
  
This is still better because of it's cost, but [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy) can be used in strange ways. Also, it may be more effective in EDH because of the lack of a negative ability, as minor as it is.
posts.html:
It's like Necromancy, except cheaper, gives it -1/0, and doesn't give you the choice of playing it at instant speed.

This is still better because of it's cost, but Necromancy can be used in strange ways. Also, it may be more effective in EDH because of the lack of a negative ability, as minor as it is.

Posted By: Chamale (11/17/2011 10:50:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@The\_Wolf  
  
That wording wouldn't work. An "enchant creature" spell needs a creature target in order to be cast, which is why this new version starts with "enchant creature card in a graveyard" - it targets a creature in the graveyard. For the same reason, the original version used "enchant dead creature" because it looked for a target in the graveyard; the problem with that being that once the creature leaves the graveyard its no longer dead.
posts.html:
@The_Wolf

That wording wouldn't work. An "enchant creature" spell needs a creature target in order to be cast, which is why this new version starts with "enchant creature card in a graveyard" - it targets a creature in the graveyard. For the same reason, the original version used "enchant dead creature" because it looked for a target in the graveyard; the problem with that being that once the creature leaves the graveyard its no longer dead.

Posted By: Rikiaz (11/21/2011 1:07:05 PM)

posts.post_content:
This is the best reanimation spell, hands down, for this reason:   
  
I could honestly see this card getting reprinted into an actual Standard-Legal set thanks to Naturalize, if only the effect could be reworded in a way that is just more concise and readable--  
  
Reanimation Ritual 1B  
Enchantment  
  
When Reanimation Ritual enters the battlefield, return a creature card in a graveyard to the battlefield under your control with a -1/-1 counter on it. When Reanimation Ritual leaves the battlefield, sacrifice that creature.  
  
  
Well?  
Advantage of using the -1/-1 counter would be to reduce exploiting hasty creatures with 1 toughness. Exhibit A: Ball Lightning.
posts.html:

Well?
Advantage of using the -1/-1 counter would be to reduce exploiting hasty creatures with 1 toughness. Exhibit A: Ball Lightning.

Posted By: Arthindole (12/28/2011 12:42:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This new art is too close up, not enough of a scene. There's just 'dead guy in your face' with some rocks breaking out from around him. The motion of the rocks makes it look like he's blowing them away, not rising from them (as though this art was originally intended for a loss of life spell).The old art, with the bodies wreathed in eerie flames rising from the ground, was much better.  
  
Still a solid card and a favorite in reanimator, especially for snagging your opponent's utility creatures. It doesn't matter if [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) or [Magus of the Future](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Future) has 1 less power, now does it? Especially when you got them for {1}{B} on the second turn after a first turn [Ostracize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ostracize)...
posts.html:
This new art is too close up, not enough of a scene. There's just 'dead guy in your face' with some rocks breaking out from around him. The motion of the rocks makes it look like he's blowing them away, not rising from them (as though this art was originally intended for a loss of life spell).The old art, with the bodies wreathed in eerie flames rising from the ground, was much better.

Still a solid card and a favorite in reanimator, especially for snagging your opponent's utility creatures. It doesn't matter if Seedborn Muse or Magus of the Future has 1 less power, now does it? Especially when you got them for {1}{B} on the second turn after a first turn Ostracize...
